qas.question: What form of government does Portugal maintain?
What is Portugal's Social Progress ranking?
Which three Western European countries have a lower Social Progress ranking than Portugal?
What are three international organizations that Portugal belongs to?

answers.text: United Nations, the European Union, the Eurozone, OECD, NATO and the Community of Portuguese Language Countries

qas.question: In 2001, Portugal was the first country in the world to do what?

answers.text: decriminalized the usage of all common drugs

context: Portugal maintains a <a0_0>unitary semi-presidential republican<a0_0/> form of government and is a developed country with an advanced economy, and a high living standard, having the <a1_0>18th highest<a1_0/> Social Progress in the world, putting it ahead of other Western European countries like <a2_0>France, Spain and Italy<a2_0/>. It is a member of numerous international organizations, including the <a3_0>United Nations, the European Union, the Eurozone, OECD, NATO and the Community of Portuguese Language Countries<a3_0/>. Portugal is also known for having <a4_0>decriminalized the usage of all common drugs<a4_0/> in 2001, the first country in the world to do so. However, drugs are still illegal in Portugal.
